name: Clomipramine (Anafranil)
summary: A tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) primarily used for obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD), with additional efficacy in depression and anxiety disorders.
description: Clomipramine is a tricyclic antidepressant that strongly inhibits serotonin reuptake and, to a lesser extent, norepinephrine reuptake. It is considered one of the most effective medications for obsessive-compulsive disorder and is also used for depression, panic disorder, and certain chronic pain conditions. Due to its anticholinergic and cardiac side effects, clomipramine is generally reserved for cases where SSRIs are ineffective.

monitoring_required: ECG in patients over 40 or with cardiac risk

sections.text: Clomipramine inhibits the serotonin transporter (SERT) more strongly than the norepinephrine transporter (NET), increasing synaptic serotonin and, to a lesser degree, norepinephrine levels. It also has anticholinergic, antihistaminic, and alpha-adrenergic blocking properties.

adult.titrate: Increase by 25 mg every 4–7 days as tolerated
adult.usual_range: 100–250 mg/day in divided doses or once daily at bedtime

sections.geriatric: Start at 10–25 mg daily; increase slowly
sections.hepatic_impairment: Use with caution; monitor plasma levels

sections.text: OCD symptom improvement may be seen in 4–6 weeks; antidepressant effects generally begin within 2–4 weeks.

sections.black_box: Antidepressants increase the risk of suicidal thinking and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults.
other: Risk of cardiac conduction abnormalities; consider baseline and follow-up ECGs
Avoid abrupt discontinuation to prevent withdrawal symptoms

items: Plasma drug levels if toxicity suspected

sections.pregnancy: Category C; use only if benefits outweigh risks
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; monitor infant for sedation
sections.pediatrics: Approved for OCD in ages 10+; monitor closely
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity to anticholinergic and cardiac effects

sections.text: Reduce dose gradually over several weeks to minimize withdrawal effects.

items: Considered the most effective TCA for OCD
SSRIs are typically first-line; clomipramine used when SSRIs fail
Monitor closely for cardiac side effects at higher doses
